reviewText: DAY OF ANGER stars two of the spaghetti genre's superstars. Lee Van Cleef is the fast gunslinger, Giuliano Gemma is the young man, son of a prostitute, made fun of and treated shamelessly by the town that is taken under the wing of the older, more experienced man. Scott Mary(his mother's name) is tutored in the use of a short gun, he seems to have a natural talent, and he and Van Cleef take over the town.Van Cleef is righting old wrongs, but he goes to far with the only man who ever treated the young man decently and it causes a confrontation between the pair in the finale of the film.DAY OF ANGER was voted on the Spaghetti Western Database as one of the top twenty films in the genre.And it is.

reviewerName: Lunar Strain "Thrash, don't mind if I do"
reviewText: I am a Spaghetti Western fan. Because of this I decided to purchase a number of rather rare films on DVD by Wild East Entertainment. One of thes films is the classic Lee Van Cleef western Day of Anger.The first DVD I recieved of Day of Anger had some major problems. I ordered the disc BRAND NEW from amazon directly and the disc contained many DEEP scratches, fingerprint smudges, and the center of the disc was even cracked. I sent the disc back to get a replacement. The second disc I recieved was also scratched badly. I'm not sure who is in charge of making these Wild Eest Entertainment discs but holy hell, give me a break! For brand new discs they look and play like a an ex-rental that had been used as a frisbee. I sent the disc back for a second time because the film skipped. The third disc I recieved...what a surprise...was also really scratched. Enough is enough! How many times do I have to send a disc back in order to get a disc that is in LIKE NEW condition and plays fine!This is not the only problem i had with Wild East DVDs I ordered. I also ordered the DVDs Santara and Gentleman Killer. I will say up front that I have a normal television (not some fancy widescreen TV) and a normal high quality Sony DVD player. When I played either one of those DVDs...the image come up scruntched on my TV. It's not like I have a widescreen TV playing non-anamorphic discs. I have a normal everyday TV. I emailed Wild East Entertainment about the problem and they eventually responded that it was a manufacturing defect on their part and the person has to switch their DVD player manually to 16x9 to play properly on their TV. Sadly I was unable to do this on my DVD player and the company offered my money back if I sent back the discs along with my amazon receipt. I sent the DVD to them. It's been months and I have not recieved any refund and they refuse to email me back. They took my DVDs and never sent me a refund and refuse to answer my letters and emails. I have NEVER been treated so poorly and they basically robbed me of $40.The "Taste of Killing" DVD also has some video glitches but I assume I warned potential buyers enough about "Wild East Entertainment". I respect the work they are trying to do by releasing hard to find Spaghetti Westerns but they need to shape up or ship out. Releasing defective discs that are poorly manufactured (like the Day of Anger disc) is upsetting. Their customer service promising refunds that never arrive and ignoring emails and letters is childish. It's a shame because I bought a LOT of their DVD's but the defective discs and their customer service giving false promises ensures that I will NEVER buy another one of their products again.
summary: A warning about Wild East Entertainment
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Review refers to the WILD EAST DVD release.Wild East have done a brilliant job in remastering this otherwise unknown Lee Van Cleef Italian Western.Picture Quality is Excellent. Widescreen Ratio: 2:35:1  Extras include: an isolated Music Score from the ever excellent Riz Ortolani and Interviews with the actor Giuliano Gemma who in my opinion is second in line to Lee Van Cleef as the greatest Star of Italian Westerns, there has been much debate on this subject on the internet.If you are a Van Cleef or Spaghetti Western Fan this DVD is a must buy. You won't be disappointed

reviewText: When I first heard about this "Spaghetti" I was mildly intrigued. Then I found out the DVD was "rare" and I was curious. Then I saw the pricetag and said "fahgetaboutit!" And then I broke down and bought it. Not only does it live up to the hype, it was totally worth the price of admission!
summary: I Own All Wildeast DVD's And Never Had Any Problems!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Being a huge LVC fan, I was excited to come across this title.  Great artwork - too bad the movie doesn't live up to the exciting poster art.  The only thing this flick has going for it besides LVC and the poster art is the outstanding score by Riz Ortalini.  One of the most awesome non-Morricone spaghetti western scores ever.I would rate this one even with Beyond the Law, another lesser LVC effort that also has TV quality sets and acting.  Even the action was minimal.  The storyline was similar to but not done nearly as well as Death Rides A Horse.For the best of LVC, I would recommend (in order)The Big Gundown, Death Rides a Horse, The Grand Duel, El Condor and even Captain Apache before I would recommend Day of Anger.  Way overrated and WAAAAAAY overpriced.  WildEast should be ashamed of themselves trying to get thirty dollars for this disc.Save your bucks on this DVD and just get the soundtrack CD of the score while it is still in print.  Believe me, you'll get way more miles outta the CD than you will this DVD...
Title: N/A
